resources.string: Do you have a Twitch or YouTube channel?
Include the keyword \"lichess.org\" in your stream title and use the category \"Chess\" when you stream on Lichess.
Remove the keyword when you stream non-Lichess stuff.
Lichess will detect your stream automatically and enable the following perks:

string.name: rule4
string.comment: the resulting message is: Read our streaming Fairplay FAQ to ensure a fair play for everyone in your stream

resources.string: Read our %s to ensure fair play for everyone during your stream.
Benefits of streaming with the keyword
Get a flaming streamer icon on your Lichess profile.
Get bumped up to the top of the streamers list.
Show your stream in your games, tournaments and studies.
Your stream is being reviewed by moderators.
Please fill in your streamer information, and upload a picture.
When you are ready to be listed as a Lichess streamer, %s

The Lichess streamer page targets your audience with the language provided by your streaming platform. Set the correct default language for your chess streams in the app or service you use to broadcast.
Please allow up to 72 hours before your streamer badge and listing are approved.
Choose the YouTube channel you will use on Lichess.

string.name: connect
string.comment:
This button appears for streamers who wish to connect a Twitch or YouTube account, to their Lichess account.
Technical information: It is specifically an OAuth connection.

string.name: disconnect
string.comment:
This button appears for streamers who wish to disconnect an already-linked Twitch or YouTube account, from their Lichess account.
Technical information: It is specifically an OAuth connection.

string.name: visibility
string.comment: A togglable setting. When enabled, the streamer profile you created will be listed on https://lichess.org/streamer

string.name: whenApproved
string.comment:
Subtitle to "Visible on the streamers page".
This subtitle is to clarify that Lichess moderators approve all applications for the https://lichess.org/streamer page

resources.string: Tell us about your stream in one sentence
